events.originalText: The Indian Space Research Organisation launched the Mars Orbiter Mission, India's first interplanetary probe.
events.subtitle: ISRO
events.headline: ISRO Launches Mars Orbiter Mission, India's First Interplanetary Probe

events.originalText: U.S. Army major Nidal Hasan went on a shooting rampage at Fort Hood, Texas, the worst shooting ever to take place on an American military base, killing 13.
events.subtitle: United States Army
events.headline: Fort Hood Shooting: U.S. Army Major Nidal Hasan Kills 13 in Rampage

events.originalText: American serial killer Gary Ridgway pleaded guilty to 48 counts of first-degree murder.
events.subtitle: Gary Ridgway
events.headline: Gary Ridgway Pleads Guilty to 48 Counts of First-Degree Murder

events.originalText: Aline Chrétien (pictured) thwarted André Dallaire's attempt to assassinate her husband, Canadian prime minister Jean Chrétien, by locking the bedroom door in 24 Sussex Drive, their official residence in Ottawa.
events.subtitle: Aline Chrétien
events.headline: Aline Chrétien Thwarts Assassination Attempt on Canadian PM Jean Chrétien

events.originalText: Ultra-Zionist rabbi Meir Kahane  was assassinated in a New York City hotel by an Arab gunman.
events.subtitle: Zionism
events.headline: Ultra-Zionist Rabbi Meir Kahane Assassinated in New York City

events.originalText: Korean War: The 27th British Commonwealth Brigade succeeded in preventing a Chinese breakthrough at the Battle of Pakchon.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: 27th British Commonwealth Brigade Prevents Chinese Breakthrough at Battle of Pakchon

events.originalText: World War II: Allied forces begin a military campaign on Japanese-occupied Singapore.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied Forces Begin Military Campaign on Japanese-Occupied Singapore

events.originalText: World War II: An unknown aircraft dropped four bombs on Vatican City, which maintained neutrality during the war.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Unknown Aircraft Drops Bombs on Vatican City During World War II

events.originalText: An armed confrontation in Everett, Washington, between local authorities and members of the Industrial Workers of the World resulted in seven deaths.
events.subtitle: Everett massacre
events.headline: Confrontation in Everett, Washington, Results in Seven Deaths

events.originalText: Seven Years' War: Prussian forces led by Frederick the Great defeated the allied French and Habsburg armies at the Battle of Rossbach.
events.subtitle: Seven Years' War
events.headline: Prussian Forces Defeat French and Habsburg Armies at Battle of Rossbach

events.originalText: The arrest of Guy Fawkes, found during a search of the Palace of Westminster, foiled the Gunpowder Plot, which planned to blow up the House of Lords.
events.subtitle: Guy Fawkes
events.headline: Arrest of Guy Fawkes Foils Gunpowder Plot to Blow Up House of Lords

events.originalText: At the Second Battle of Panipat, forces of the Mughal emperor Akbar captured Hemu, the Hindu emperor of north India.
events.subtitle: Second Battle of Panipat
events.headline: Mughal Forces Capture Hindu Emperor Hemu at Second Battle of Panipat

events.originalText: Lý Anh Tông was enthroned as the emperor of Đại Việt at the age of two, beginning a 37-year reign.
events.subtitle: Lý Anh Tông
events.headline: Lý Anh Tông Enthroned as Emperor of Đại Việt at Age of Two
